So, our tip and trick, we've got two 
because we've been diving into provisioning.
The first tip trick is to check out Fleet Provisioning.

So I'll just bring up a  quick view 
of where you're gonna find that on AWS.

But for Fleet Provisioning,
 the thing that is really cool

is that this allows you to use what's called
a Claim Certificate to onboard devices.

With the tips and best practices 
if you use Fleet Provisioning

it comes with a pre-hook Lambda,
so use Lambda to whitelist

which devices you have,
so you can actually do some more validation checks.

We also recommend 
that for Fleet Provisioning

just make sure that you have 
a scaled down IOT policy.

But, you're looking for a way to get started 
on-boarding your devices

and you use claim certificates,
definitely check out Fleet Provisioning

as a Part One of tips and tricks,
and then for our Part Two for tips and tricks:

all around provisioning
is Multi-account Registration.

So what's really cool with Multi-account Registration
is that, back in the day, when you created a cert

as Tim kind of showed 
in his example of Bootstrap and Greengrass

it could only live in one AWS account.
But with Multi-account Registration

you can take a certificate, 
and then register it in multiple accounts

without requiring a CA.
So, two thing to check out

Fleet Provisioning and Multi-account Registration
are our two tips and tricks.
